aXAvtyUCt7eOm6sGuMqBSA.text: To me, this restaurant seems considerably overpriced.  Maybe I will feel better about eating in next time instead of getting takeout though.    Mapo Tofu was weird, like a cornstarch-thickened sweet tomato soup, lightly spicy, with almost nonexistent meat.  I like the Mapo Tofu at Grand Sign Kitchen nearby a lot more, they use bigger shreds of pork than any of my dishes here had, bigger tofu, less and different sauce.    Could barely tell the difference between the $11 Japchaebap and $19 Gochu Japchae, the more expensive one was in a different container but the portion looked pretty much the same.  The pork is cut tissue-thin.  For the amount of cost, every entree should come with side dishes, not just 1 set of tiny tubs for the whole order.  The flavoring on everything was very mild (which may be to your taste).  On the plus side, everything tasted fresh and light, no 'old oil' taste.  Every dish we ordered has lots of onions to make the portions look bigger and one of the side dishes is onions.  Perhaps I would enjoy one of the fried pork dishes more, or soup.  I feel like this place has potential to be better.

The waiter was pretty friendly. He filled up my water very consistently and made sure we had everything we needed. All in all, I rate this place a 4/5. atsxO-TFoXLppRc8Jp02Zg.text: This place was pretty good when it first opened.  Now it's gone severely downhill.  My young son and I got MASSIVE food poisoning when we came here.  Not sure what dish it was but it was terrible.  The jja jang myun used to be good here.  Not it's a plate of soy bean sauce and raw cabbage.  It's a shame they've just gotten so lazy.  Bad quality and no quality control.

VzM7cKWoW-ep-5bDh_Xpcg.text: It is so addicting to come here on happy hour (after 9pm). We have been letting friends and family to come here. I like their hot tea, the cleanliness of the place, the unique oriental design and super friendly and attentive servers. Thank you Sunny and Jared( hope I got your name right). They suggest what food to eat and how to eat it. Superb!

xLdgaeQ8vt8UC2_TqVe2OQ.text: Their happy hour is so affordable and tasty. Their jap chae literally compelled me to write this 5 star review. The servers were courteous and nice on top of their high quality food. Cannot recommend enough

ECV0S2PKnf0o-LIuTymcAA.text: I enjoyed our lunch here after church. The decor and furnishings makes me feel like im in a different time.. like the Chinese restaurants in the Korean dramas. The servers are nice and welcoming. They put us in an inside booth which made my dad feel great since it gave us privacy. We had jajangmyeon with of coursw tangsuyuk (sweet and sour pork). The jajangmyeon was really good and the tangsuyuk was so crunchy just the way I like it. They dont seem to serve red kimchi just white kimchi but it was delicious so I was very happy. This is definitely the best jajangmyeon place for me in Vegas. I should rate it 5 star but Mom asked for a glass of water but the server put the water in a glass where she drank sprite from which my mom thought was.. to put it bluntly a bit barbaric. I think she should be very careful with this. I dont think this is acceptable even in Korea so cultural differences should not be an excuse. The guy server that waited on us before her was polite and pleasant.

Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jajangmyeon and Tangsuyuk works well with Sprite!
Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jajangmyeon with sweet and sour pork

iPUb5OoLf_pAsOtIyKEDAg.text: Had a late Father's Day dinner here last night. Just so happened that they also started serving happy hour from 9pm-1am. Man, what an extra treat. Frist off, I have been here multiple times before. My family and I LOVE everything about this place. The ambience, the decorations, the spacious settings and the unique hole in the wall asian dining experience. The servings are huge, exactly how our family needs it to be since we always eat family style. The service has always been great (crossing fingers that it doesn't EVER go sour). Most importantly, the food is AMAZING!! Great authentic taste of Asian cuisine. Anyways, I happen to love it here. I hope this place continues to grow!

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hr serving is still perfectly proportioned for the price w/ every bit of flavor delivered to every bite. This was an order for 2.

5XgFqBQNU57yNB_FWz2ORw.text: I come here because it's one of the only Korean Chinese restaurant south of the 215. One dish I especially enjoy is the black bean noodle aka jjajjangmyun. My husband always gets the spicy seafood noodles or jjamppong. One thing that's really good is the fried pork dish or tangsooyuk. It's fairly big and it can be shared among 3-4 people! It's not too sweet and the pork is fried to a crisp which is great because if it was soggy it would suck.  This place also delivers but if you get the noodles it may not be a good idea because the noodles get hard and rubber like.   The side dishes are plain with kimchi, yellow radish, and raw onion with black bean sauce. The side dishes could use an improvement. I mainly order Togo and eat at home since I have better tasting side dishes hehe!  Overall we are fine with the food but it isn't super amazing.

YNSmfOCOMEUOw8Dc-GTK_A.text: What a pleasant surprise! Located away from busy Strip, this is one of the best Korean style Chinese restaurant in the USA!  I took visitors from Korea here and they were all impressed with legit spiciness of Jjamppong and flavorful Jjajangmyeun.  Open until midnight is also a plus!

wzoDo9Pn19TGc0huaRu6BA.text: This is my go to Chinese Restaurant. Prices are reasonable and food is good! We come here at least once a week

ok6mlVWK44H5MQ26B15n6w.text: the food is ok, but hygiene need to be improved. Hehe. First I found out a hair on the onion, I kept silent and didn't really wanna ruin my friend appetite. And few mins later, I found another unidentifiable little thing, looks like dry plastic something. I reminded the waiter With a smile after we paid. He apologized to us and left with embarrassment. Hah.

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JkwT3XwrT67Vcm25Hd43iQ.text: Went here because the korean barstaurant a block away was way too crowded and noisy; this on the other hand, was extremely quiet and almost empty. Tee decor and cleanliness, however, was really pretty and everything was spotless. Service was also on point as the employees would always come to check up on us, gave us nice friendly smiles, and even offered to help us pick some yummy things that we might like. We ended up going for this clear noodle dish with lots of good toppings on top (I honestly can't remember the name). It was a giant dish for 2 people (or 3 petite tummies), though I probably could've shared that and another dish since I was a hungry hippo. Food was done nicely and there were plenty of toppings (we mixed the noodles with mustard!) I wish I got to try the jajjangmyeon, but alas, we didn't have enough people. Price-wise, this joint is on the higher end, though maybe it's because this is Vegas? (I live in LA and you can find a lot of good-but-cheap(er) Korean/Chinese restaurants).   Overall, as much as I think the price could be a wee bit lower, this place still deserves a 5 star for excellent service, cleanliness, and well made food. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot what it was called... Seafood and wide clear noodles

LcWpgej-qcz9502bzfx4qw.text: Ordered the Sam sung jja jang myun and the tang su yook (pork).  Both dishes were good.  Wife thought this was the meatiest and tastiest jja jang she's had ever.  Clean place and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bn_V_rb_0N1rpxcv3Rimyw.text: I've ordered Togo before and was amazed enough to come have a sit down meal here! I'm not very familiar with Korean Chinese, but luckily there's an American Chinese menu that fits me very well!!!  The seating seems to be traditional and not necessarily comfortable because the table hangs too low to have your legs fit under.

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uOOTrS3UHfCttaGHzwQ0kw.text: Came here with a few friends for dinner. We were seated right away for a table of 5. This place serves Korean Chinese, meaning not authentic Chinese food but Korean styled Chinese food.   Food:  Jaengban Bokkeum Jjamppong (5 stars) comes with jumbo shrimp, squid and other assorted seafood along with noodles. Broth is fairly spicy even though they ask if you if you'd like it extra spicy, I think the regular spice way spicy enough. Good flavor and quite large size. You could probably get 5-6 small bowls out of this dish.  Jaengban Jjajang- (5 stars) I would especially recommend this dish. We got the extra large size and there was quite a bit. This dish is made with some seafood, pork, veggies and black bean. Sauce with noodles were absolutely delicious!! Favorite dish of the night.  Steamed dumplings (4 stars) - nothing special but good dish nonetheless. I believe this dumpling is made with pork and vegetables.   Baby bokchoy (5 stars)- good dish and very good portion. The thing I look for when I eat this dish is that it the bokchoy is very clean and does not have any sort of dirt near the stem. Looked at the pieces I ate and they looked pretty good! (You can tell I eat a lot of Asian veggies)   Tang su yuk (5 stars)- very good fry on this dish!!you could tell the oil was very fresh and the fry on the breading was done right. Highly recommend this di  Overall great spot and would definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jaengban Bokkeum Jjamppong
Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jaengban Jjajang

lSVFcXot5q5Vycn3YKepUQ.text: It was our first time here. Hubby and i went for lunch on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all.  We really didn't know what to get so we ended up just getting the Samseon Jjamppong with white sauce, which had absolutely no heat. My husband liked it, where for me, I'd definitely like to try the soup with heat. I was surprised that I really liked this soup. The noodles were delicious and the broth had a miso color to it since there were no peppers. The seafood was cooked perfectly.  We weren't offered tea but had to wait a bit when we did ask for it. I believe the hot water machine that boiled the water wasn't working or something so they had to boil the water some other way. When they brought the tea out, the little kettle that they gave us leaked when we poured the tea so we got water all over the table.  We were never asked if we wanted anything else, instead the male server automatically asked if we wanted the check so my husband just said yes. I guess we're just used to other restaurants where they ask if you'd be interested in dessert.  All in all, I'm sure we'll be back to try the other entrees since it's fairly close to our house and we don't have to drive all the way to Chinatown.

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjamppong with white sauce (not spicy at all)
Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside decor.. it&#39;s pretty cute
Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim chi was pretty good

0amCfoDCSb7PMP-zhAzCng.text: Fair prices and quick service.  I came for lunch and although I didn't partake, they offered some nice lunch deals with 2-3 dishes for under $20.  At Yu XIang, though, the portion size is very generous so this is a steal and a meal for the next day.  I opted for the jajangmyeon small portion.  I was easily full for about $7.50.  Couple this with a few banchan of radish and cabbage and onion, and the meal was great.  The entree was a little plain with just paste and noodle and small portions of meat and greens, but tasty nonetheless.  All in all, the meal was really good and service was quick and no nonsense.  The tables aren't the best for tall people though as they drop pretty low.    Yu Xiang offers soju and other drinks so it can be a family meal or a late night destination.  Either way, a nice, different, option in the food-centric plaza.

tbIDcjhpCIhmogdAsCliVA.text: Good flavor, noodles fresh, great prices, decor nice, service polite, prices for jjangjang were excellent for the portion. Good job.

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BYj5iEZRuUEj1ILdUoA-fg.text: If you're looking for a good jjangmyun, tangsuyuk, kampongsaewoo, etc...then this not the place. Jjangmyun tasted very bland with lack of flavor. Tangsuyuk was one of the worst that we ever had. This dish sucked! We thought the battered and fried meat was okay but the sauce was too basic and tasted odd. It was definitely missing some key ingredients. Not the typical tangsuyuk flavor. The kampongsaewoo was mixed with Korean red chili sauce (gochujang) which was odd too. We did not enjoy this at all. We thought the Jjampong was decent and so were the pork yakimandoo. The restaurant is clean and the service was good but as far as food is concerned, we didn't like it. Not your typical Korean-Chinese restaurant.

yyyzbAuA9iVKQwMWCimG9g.text: Not a terrible experience, but not outstanding either. I'm a fan of Korean and Chinese food, so we were excited to give YuXiang a try. Unfortunately, the food and service only deserve 3 stars.   The japchae was slightly mushy and literally had an entire onion in it. I don't mind onion, but this was way too much. There was a tiny amount of other veggies. The flavor was okay, but not anything like traditional japchae.  The Mongolian beef was good. Tender and cooked well. The chicken fried rice was also pretty good. But neither were memorable.  The jajangmyun was a little soupy, flavor was okay, but again, nothing special.   We also ordered mandoo (which didn't have any sauce). Our total came to $57.  We sat down soon after arriving and a server brought us complimentary hot tea and ice water. They don't offer free refills on soda/iced tea (served in cans) which is a pet peeve of mine. Overall service was okay, not great but not awful.   Parking is also an issue here. There are 3 restaurants, a Dairy Queen and a few other businesses all sharing a small parking lot.   In my opinion, when you consider the price, quality of both food and service, along with the inconvenient parking situation, I don't see myself coming back.

s8_c5EkTBEAfliNFfVgkIA.text: I love this place and it's the closest jajangmein and jjamppong that I've found that taste like Korea.   I'm hooked on this place and get it delivered at least once a week.   I'm a nut for spicy foods and their bur jjamppong aka fire jjamppong is incredible. I ask for extra spicy and can't feel my tongue afterwards but it's like a sickness because I love it.   They offer traditional korean noodles at a great price. I highly suggest to give it a try.

WyOv0m2t1nNapm0-QzlLyQ.text: Had the orange chicken without the chili flakes....it just might have been the best orange chicken I've ever had, shared it with both of my kids and they scarfed it down! Will be returning! The Mrs had a vegetarian dish but it was amazing!

uK2qaDCe5-2LxXnFWSBk9A.text: Best jjajangmyeon in town! Well, to me at least! Friendly and helpful staff. Love the decor and ambiance...feels like you're somewhere in China. My husband ordered jjajangmyeon and I ordered jjampong and both were delicious!! The noodles were perfect, soup-tasty. Never cared for jjajangmyeon before but this place made me wanting more! Black bean sauce was mmm so gooOoood! Even my 16 month old enjoyed it!! Generous portions! I definitely will be back!!!

PHZIm_gwfmGOUkLfK09wZw.text: Very good restaurant and now is open at 10:30am and close at 1 am  good service food very testy

hXnsZyEKfpkI3LE-wN-HnQ.text: Great, local restaurant! Food is delicious, service is great and the atmosphere is amazing. Beautiful interior decor and reasonable prices! We came for late night happy hour and portions are shareable and at great prices! Will definitely be coming back.

uNBxR1nULZRH30bynkzlTQ.text: I went there after 9pm and they had happy hours.  Service was excellent I give 5 stars for service.  Servers were attentive and friendly.  I give food 3stars. I ordered 3 items. I'm very familiar with traditional Korean Chinese dishes.  I ordered jajjanmyun, gochoo chapche, and shrimp kkambung. Jajjangmyun was pretty good. I liked it.  Gochoo chapche was delicious. Flavor was great. It was missing meat though.  When I order gochoo chapche from other places most places have meat in gochoo chapche. But flavor was still great wish they put meats like pork or beef.  Shrimp kkambung wasn't good. It didn't taste like traditional kkambung. I was little disappointed by kkambung. Even color of sauce and taste was nothing like traditional kkambung. And I thought fried shrimp were little too greasy for me,  Overall service and happy hour prices were great.  Because I live close by the restaurant and there's no other traditional KOREAN Chinese restaurant near my location I would go back there.

Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kyJbJYmXbK5ZlsIl5050OQ.text: This was the best Chinese we have found yet in Vegas! Authentic and delicious! We went on NYE and it was so yummy! Friendly service too!

uEQG6omf7kBuXvioopglVg.text: Oodles of noodles!  Alejandro B. and myself took a drive all the way from the north side of town for some YuXiang. I was tired of @LasVegasPhil posting his scrumptious looking bowls of freshly made noodles every other week, so I went to see what the fuss was all about. The interior is very new and clean with fancy designed booths for extra privacy. Luckily, we had the privilege to sit in them since it was a little slow.  Our server was very nice... and pretty;) We were given suggestions for our orders to make sure we were completely satisfied. Too bad she didn't have a name tag or I would be able to express my creepy gratitude a little more Lol. Alex took one for the team and got their Jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle soup) while I played it safe with the Samseon Gan Jjajang (seafood pork vegetables with black bean sauce). Both had it's own unique flavor being sweet or spicy. We balanced out all the carbs with some crisp Spicy Wings that weren't very hot, but packed great flavor.   Overall, I was satisfied with my first visit at XuYiang. I will have to come back to try more of their authentic Korean/Chinese entrees.

TkgQzkxkTYhbKHyB1AoH4w.text: My favorite place in Las Vegas! Nice food, good staffs. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends

JNRDFNPA-PDVbwfrZyMjTQ.text: This is place to eat best korean chinese food in Las Vegas! Interior is fancy and clean too. Best jjajangmyen in my life too. Very flavory and delicious

r6uN5VQhZsDWod1rirRepg.text: My new favorite late night spot to eat at! Their happy hour specials are LEGIT! The three times I've been here I haven't had a single dish that I didn't like. I honestly think the food here is better than most places in ktown LA.

RD3KqrCOn2rB9qi384JL_g.text: I ordered oyster jjampong soup and it gave me a very serious food poisoning which occurred two days ago and still very strong. The doctor confirmed it is a Norovirus which is considered one of the worst food poisonings, and it can be caused by unfresh oysters.

jg-FQksnbdDVzMQcL76Xfg.text: The atmosphere in the restaurant is so nice and pretty. The workers were extremely friendly as well! I ordered the Samseon Gan Jjajang, and I was very satisfied. There was a perfect amount of cabbage and onions to the meat and seafood I had. Definitely recommend to come here for some jjajang noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f7JdIwMPMNh_4ZyweAZrBA.text: I loved all! Interior, service and of course foods. Especially their jjampong was really excellent! I will do visit again!

gD_qzoODIzkeHkZZculEAQ.text: Food is about 4 stars  Service is about a 1 star   I was soooooooooooo excited to try this place after seeing all of these noodle pulls on Instagram. I showed my husband and he knows that my love for noodles is ridiculous. So we decided to order to go...they have an online system but it's hard to customize such as no onions and such so we decided to just call. We were able to order with our specifications and the outcome was delish. There's a lot of protein and plenty of noodles when we got it. I would def recommend dining in though just because the seafood does get over cooked when you get it to go unless you live 2 min away. I was excited that I found a noodle place that wasn't the same.   We came back another time and I had ordered to go on our way there. They told me 30 minutes so by the time we got there we still had 10 minutes left. My husband went inside and he texted me saying that a to go order was ready! That was fast thinking that was ours. Well it turns out that the lady working there said it was NOT our order. He texted me 10 min later saying that he was still waiting. I asked him if we could cancel and he said he already paid since that was the 30 minutes that they had told us. He waited another 10min and that order that was ready when he got there? Yea that was ours! The lady didn't even apologize for making us wait another 20 minutes for food that was all ready ready. Not cool! This experience has left me with a bitter taste in my mouth and I think I'll be skipping this place from now on. Way to go for the bad service and parking kind of stinks there since it's a small lot.

Fn6jn-HOmMYvrHkvbN10cg.text: Lunch special is really good deal. They also delivery. We had a delivery yesterday, and we came here to get a lunch special today. It was so delicious

d84Cn9koIRX1E3Cyz7LeDg.text: Great food and service!!  I've got Tangsuyuk + 1 Jjajangmyun + 1 Jjambbong as a lunch combo, and Yangjangpi also. For the lunch combo, Tangsuyuk is half portion. Jjajangmyun has been upgraded to Samsun Jjajangmyun by $1.00. Love it!! Tangsuyuk is super crispy and it's sauce was sweet and sour!! Yangjangpi is my favorite food of Chinese-Korean fusion restaurant, and it was super great!  Additionally, service was awesome!!  Definitely I'll come back!!  Love this place

JjHOZJ2xugLe08Dn8LWvzA.text: We came on opening day.  It was ok.  We had jajangmyun (noodles with black bean sauce), jjampong (spicy seafood noodle), potstickers, and another dish...can't recall the name, but it featured lots of bamboo shoots and mushrooms.  The dishes were ok.  My favorite was the potstickers.  They make them in-house.  It was their first day (a soft opening on a Tuesday) but it was packed.  (A good sign).  But the reason I give a 4 star...they didn't have any dessert ready...we were with 2 children who had anticipated dessert.  Service was great as well.  Definitely worth trying again once they get more comfortable.

H5UNqYU_0J0Vliw3RIapqg.text: Great place for Korean Style Chinese Cuisine! Not too expensive and great service from staff. I ordered the Black Bean Noodles special and it was fantastic! Highly recommended for those who love Korean Style cuisine!

Plq859GFbbU-_WSvbJj-ng.text: Cute decor and friendly service!!  The jajangmyeon was delicious!  I will definitely be going back there anytime I need a jajangmyeon fix.  They give you kitchen shears to cut the long noodles.  I had never been to a place that did that before, but oddly enough it made the dish feel even more homemade and fresh.  Good experience!

GCDCBT0UQEY3R4FtZcJR4w.text: Really good portions!! Amazing fried dumplings!! The ambiance is top notch. Good price for the food! The service is excellent! Would definitely recommend this place!

VAkDrUl5Vaz3ImcF40hmHA.text: finally found my jja jang spot in vegas!!!  good service and good food!!  best part, my daughter loved it

VPph8_6ZjlrVZnyPPRfwLw.text: The jampong, spicy seafood noodle dish, is amazing! Along with the tangsuyuk, sweet and sour pork! Definitely have to try this place! I know we will be going back time after time in the near future!

J_iJHit7Y7PditO1DinU6A.text: Very good place for noodles! There are many vegetables and meat in the noodles. The size is also able to make you feel very full.

EiiMsaU3_IsDq8XQ4rxgmg.text: Went here for lunch today. Been wanting to try this place because one of my favorite food is black bean noodles. I also saw that they had sweet and sour pork.  Arriving here their were a few tables occupied. No one greeted us at the door until after a couple of minutes. A young man pointed us to a booth and left. We waited a little over 5 minutes for the same man who I come and check on us and realized we didn't have menus. The menu is separated by categories which was easy to read and understand. Before arriving I knew I wanted to try their black bean noodles and sweet and sour pork. Luckily it was on their lunch special. We got the second to the last lunch special because it included the sweet and sour pork, black bean noodle and their spicy seafood soup with noodles.  The first dish was the sweet sour pork. They brought it out with the sauce on the side. Which I prefer because I like my pork to be and stay crispy. The sauce and vegetables was good. It's not the typical red or pink sauce that most places will have. All in all I would rate I a 7/10.  The black bean noodles was the second dish I tried. Honestly, this flavor was underwhelming. I felt that the noodles were over cooked and the sauce needed more flavor. I would rather eat the ones from Greenland market's food court noodles. 5/10 Spicy seafood noodle soup was spicy. I wish I knew to ask for a mild one. I did like it. Never had it before so didn't know what to compare it to. The only downside was the seafood was a little overcooked.

wtyVqXqCksnh1MII6aFcsw.text: Excellent food!  Delicious, fresh and wonderful decor... the service was excellent!!  Order the Samsung Jia Jang Noodles and tea!!!  The music, ambiance and food is so fresh and tasty and right off the 215...  Authentic Korean Chinese

k5d0480NlUAOnXC6nwU8YQ.text: Ol the new Korean Chinese place. Had to check it out. Over all, disappointing.  Avoid the pick hours. Two of us had Jjajang myun and Jjamppong. For Jjajang myun, the sauce seemed ok but the noodle... it is obvious they reheated on hot water. Which also made the sauce watery... I think the noodle is the basic. I would understand on pick hours but it was the slowest time of a day. There were only two tables other than us. The service was good. The server, a skinny girl, was very friendly. I gotta give one more try but so far, i would rather go to the island.

0tnZ9iU6U-eP39OCv4y_lg.text: I am an big axx hole when it comes down to any reviews. But YuXiang was probably one of the best Korean Chinese Cuisine I've ever had in a long time. Perhaps the best one so far in my life. I can only give five 5 stars to this place since they've got all the basics right, in terms of *taste of the foods *great customer service *exquisite atmosphere *reasonable price point / You guys should all definitely try this place soon before they get too busy.

D3fcVO2wZBCroymV5DIlpw.text: I've been here twice and while I won't say it's the best Chinese place I've had, it's one of the better in Vegas. It's especially nice that it's so close to home for me.  I've had the regular jja jang myun and the seafood jja jang myun. I think I prefer the regular. The seafood one was a bit bland for me. The fried dumpling is delicious... and I also tried the garlic (?) chicken (kkanpungi) and that was also pretty good.  On this last visit their a/c was down and ... it was not pleasant considering it was over 100 degrees outside. Regardless food was still good, despite sweating and eating.   If you're into spicy food, the fire jjam bbong is pretty spicy. It's more on peppery side, but beware... I only took a sip of the soup but my friend said although good, you may pay for it the next day

7aGkIjgWG_9D99LeDd10ew.text: Not sure why Yelp took off my last review???? This restaurant is definitely better than 2.5 stars. MUCH better. Fair price, big portions, and above all, tasty. All you foodies out there looking for a great combo Korean Chinese place - look no further!

R3sYBmDs8-Y5UL0iqqfpbA.text: I ordered fried rice with jjang jang, it was so good. I liked the atmosphere and really good service. I recommend.

vZ9eZIqMdMKc-CmS61qlSQ.text: Went here during lunch special time   Had the Tangsuyuk and the Jjambbong Jjajangmyun. Not bad good service.

CX8YFhzF-WxxWLi8E0K6RA.text: We had dumplings, jajangmyeon, and some Korean chicken dish (garlic and chili sauce)  The food and service were great! We will be back to try some other dishes that our server suggested. Glad to have a new and good restaurant to add to the rotation.

pj-59Yuz1RYeHssIUxz1Bg.text: Really nice ambience but the food werent that special. Not enough side dishes too... compared to other places.

Lu1OSKl34E6WF3wTlJNwsA.text: Great food! Great service! Will definitely come back again! Spicy seafood noodle and Tangsuyuk is my favorite! Highly recommend to everyone!!

rpXNd5Lg9GpCQYdlD2lIpQ.text: Great place for Korean-Chinese food. I really liked the interior design of the place. The food and service was also spectacular. A definite must try is their JJang + Bokkeumbap. Overall a great experience.

h2niKqkZA-lQStt2n6foMg.text: My favorite Korean-Chinease reataurant anywhere! You can almost guarantee a great meal!! Jjajamyung and Tangsooyuk soooooo delicious!!!!

AInILeErUEzIdDu_kU3PBw.text: I loved the decoration and atomosphere.  We ordered their famous jajiang mein and seafood style as well, and both were absolutely delicious!  Service was amazing as well!  We ended up ordering too much because our eyes were bigger than our stomach! But even after we packed it for lunch the next day it was still tasty!
